name: MEAN stack deployment (hybrid-cloud)
description: MEAN - A simple and scalable starting point for full stack JavaScript web development.

metadata.longDescription: Deploys a hybrid cloud MEAN stack (Mongo, Express, Angular, Node) across AWS and IBM Cloud providing a complete development environment. This deployment also deploys a simple sample application to validate the stack is operational.

bullets.title: Clouds
bullets.description:
• Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • IBM Cloud/Softlayer

bullets.title: Operating systems supported
bullets.description:
• AWS: Ubuntu 16.04
  • IBM Cloud: CentOS 7

bullets.title: Topology
bullets.description:
Hybrid: 2 virtual machines:
  • AWS with Node.js, Angular.js, Express.js;
  • IBM Cloud with MongoDB

bullets.title: Software deployed
bullets.description:
1. MongoDB: a NoSQL database
  2. Express.js: a web application framework that runs on Node.js
  3. Angular.js: a JavaScript MVC framework that runs in browser JavaScript engines
  4. Node.js: an execution environment for event-driven server-side and networking applications

bullets.title: Default virtual machine settings
bullets.description:
• AWS:
    • Flavor: Size = t2.medium,
    •            Cores = 2, Memory = 4GB, Storage = EBS Only
    • Network: Private IP - in 10.0.1.0/24, Public IP - Computed
    • Firewall:
      • Ingress - Only allows SSH, ICMP, TCP 8443 for all sources;
      • Egress - All
  • IBM Cloud:
    • Flavor: Cores = 1, Memory = 1GB, Storage = 25GB SAN
    • Network: Private IP - Computed, Public IP - Computed
    • Firewall: Not enabled

bullets.title: Usage and special notes
bullets.description:
1. Downloads latest releases of software.
  2. Deployment takes approximately 10 minutes to complete.
  3. To access the application and virtual machines, please see the instructions in the output log.
  4. The sample application in this deployment is from the open source project https://github.com/meanjs/mean and more details can be found in http://mean.io/.
